reviewText: I love this workout. The set is beautiful. At first I thought it was going to be all down-dogs. I'm a lifelong migrainer and downdogs make myhead pound with pain. But there is so much after that!  It's a little slow, which is fine with me , but the workouts are very graceful and all of the poses I'm used to. It's a total body workout. I rented this, but I'm going to buy it!

My wife found all of Tonya Larson to be very helpful in getting back to shape with a newborn.  The routine was challenging but nothing she couldn't manage after a few weeks postpartum.  My favorite part is the spiritual warmups.  I watched them and was super impressed.  As a pastor I see all kinds of spiritual nonsense but her message was refreshing and accurate.  For the right person, it could even be life changing.

Thanks Tonya for a lovely stretching and toning routine. It is a very relaxing workout and the music is lovely. Yes, it is a Christian-centered workout with soft Christian vocals and instrumental music. I am a Christian, so I was very familiar with the lyrics and tunes. They were very modern versions and had a nice ambiant feel to them. I love all of Tonya's workouts and appreciate her Spiritual Warm-Ups and everything about her routines. This was a yoga-based routine, but she used no yoga terminalogy in describing the moves. It was very professional. I do, however enjoy a lot of yoga routines that do use the authentic yoga/sanskrit names and words. I love Raviana workouts too. Tonya is very professional, and soft-spoken and the set,music and the mats and their outfits were nice and modern. I really like this one and you can use it in segments or do the whole thing!
Good workout.  I love it!  It is a very good stretch and muscle building workout with the bonus of a christian worshipful aspect.

The title on this exercise DVD does not really match the actual content. "Yoga-Lite for Biblical Worship after Childbirth" may be a better title. Tonya leads a gentle, soft yoga practice (not powerful as in the title) geared towards intermediate practitioners. There is not a lot of sculpting performed in the practice, although her Yoga routine can provide some toning. She provides very little instruction or beginner options so I would not recommend it if you're looking for a beginner's stretching routine. For instance, during Chaturanga (slow downward movement plank), she does not give the option to lower your knees first, then goes into the full upward dog position. She does bridge pose (an advanced yoga posture) with very little instruction and poor form. Also, if you're looking for a non-demoninational practice, this is not the DVD for you. She talks specifically about God, Jesus, and Repenting and includes quotes from the bible during what's called the "Spritual Warm-Up", which assumes all spiritual practitioners believe in God and follow the Bible. It felt more like a sermon/lecture to me. This turned me off, specifically since it's marketed as a regular "stretching" video. The practice is somewhat weak, Tonya's voice is too soft and she does not provide clear enough queues so you have to look up quite often to follow her routine. Moveover, the music is too load and has church-based singing which even more overpowers her delicate voice. The introduction video section has Tonya and her single student showing their new babies. It is commendable that they both just gave birth and have made a video. All the proceeds go to "Acres 4 Life" which helps people in Africa learn to farm their land, which is awesome! I really appreciate their efforts and work helping people with their loving kindness, but again, it would be better to be straight forward in their marketing that their efforts have religious undertones. It's not that I don't support them, but they should be clear on the cover of the DVD that the proceeds will be used for religious-based projects. If you're looking for a couple excellent (non-demoninational) well produced stretching DVD's, I would recommend the following: Full Body Stretch by Karen Voight Full Body Stretch Cool it Off by Mary Schaefer Cool It Off - Debbie Siebers' Slim Series: Stretch/Recovery Workout ( DVD) Total Body Stretching by Cathe Friedrich Cathe Friedrich's Total Body Stretching DVD and Stretch Max Stretch Max with Cathe Friedrich Deep Stretch with Mimi Solaire Deep Stretch/ Yin Yoga with Mimi Solaire and Back in Shape Back in Shape Save Your Lower Back with Annetee Fletcher Save Your Lower Back - Release, Strengthen, Stretch with Annette Fletcher and Stretch & Joint Mobility Stretch and Joint Mobility Therapy Pilates for Flexibility by Amy Brown Pilates for Life: Pilates for Flexibility
Great workout/stretch video without all the new age yoga crap. Recommended for people who want to do "yoga" but don't agree with all the hokey stuff.
I love it, my whole family loves this. Very simple and easy to follow, each workout seems about 10 minutes in length!

I've been enjoyingenjoying this workout for a few years. It is not aerobically rigorous, yet it is just want my tight body needs to stretch and even strengthen some core muscles. It definitely improves my posture and eased me out of pain in my neck and back.
I thought I was watching an exercise video instead she's quoting the Bible. This is garbage, if I want to read the Bible I'll do it on my own time. very deceiving
Nice idea, but incredibly slow moving.
I like Tonya's spiritual, calm approach.

Excellent!  I just finished this workout!  I am a beginner a felt intructions were easy to follow & moves doable for new be!  Loved it that Tonya incorporated Christian mind body focus!  That was the most delightful suprise!  There are many non- Christian focus exercise video that those less than kind with their review should check out.  Tonya was honoring her core values & produce an excellent & worthy of 5 stars exercise video!  Where is the respect for Tonya Larson's Christian beliefs?  Reviewing on exercise alone is 5 stars!  Kudos Tonya Larson.  I will check out to see if you have others.  May God bless you & expand your territory!
nan

I really like this video! Even though it says it's great for a postpartum workout, it's perfect for me. I'm in my 50s and have some minor back problems. I needed something to get me stretching and working my muscles, and these stretches have really helped. I like that it's divided into several different stretch sequences, so if I don't have time to do the entire video I can pick which one or two sequences I want to do. When I first started , I could barely bend because of my back and the condition my muscles were in at the time. I'm doing so much better now and am able to do a lot of the stretches I couldn't even think of doing in the beginning. This has been a wonderful addition to my life and has really helped me physically.
Wonderful relaxing program to follow.
Slow and boring. I think she quoted a bible verse.
Love the Christian background  music.
It is good Practice , I want to know more about the right methods for breathing
Too religious for my taste. Others may like spirituality with exercise.  I don't

I'm not sure if I should fault the video or Amazon's description - but being blindsided with a Christian prayer sesh is Not ok. I think we all can agree that everyone is free to be whatever religion they want, therefore, tricking viewers via lack of information is sneaky, rude, and disrespectful. I finished the video regardless and found the stretches to be nice and relaxing (and that is the ONLY reason it is getting two stars) but I agree with other commenters that "power" and "sculpt" have no business being in the title and description.

Also - to other commenters that were complaining that yoga doesn't fit their religion -- well -- yoga is an Indian lifestyle practice. It's more than just exercises and poses to them. If you are going to partake - have some respect and appreciation for something outside of your comfort zone. If you faith is so easily shaken, I hardly think that's yoga's fault.
Was just what I needed to stretch and relax my body.
It's a quiet but sure way to exercise and telax at the same time every part of your body. Very long though.

I was looking to start stretching and exercising. I was in Awe when I turned on this video to see that the Lord works in many ways. A Christian based yoga video right at my feet. I have never come across a excersize video with scripture. It helped me through the stretches to know that the Lord was with me through this whole video. Great stretches and very relaxing.
Awesome work out

Wonderful video.  Only complaint is that I'd prefer to hold the stretches longer.  Plus, I don't care for the first 5 minutes used for prayer.  Don't need to hear the same prayer every single time.  I just fast forward through it.

easy to keep up with. basic yoga moves.
i'll use it again when i can't get to the gym and want a good stretch.
Jebus. Religious nutjobbery. Fair warning would have saved me some time.

Great yoga workout!  Loved the opening scripture and prayer.  It is refreshing to do a yoga routine not packed to new-age mumbo jumbo, telling you to become one with the earth and such!  Loved the background music.  Will definitely buy more of her dvds.

Should've read the reviews, very religious and postnatal.  Seems like a great lesson, just not for me.  Would've been great if they would allow the viewer to choose a religious/postnatal atmosphere or not.
This is a really great workout.
I loved that this is a Christian video!
I am enjoying this video, taking it slow. I like her attitude.

As someone who loves the physical and health benefits of yoga but am not attracted to the spiritual aspect of it, I find that this exercise program is excellent for Christians who are in the same boat I am in. I can see why someone of a non-religious background would dislike both this and more spiritual yoga programs, but I think it is really excellent for Christians who seek an alternative to yoga that is more focused on their own values. Highly recommend. It is a deeply prayerful way to do effective exercise.

This was a great stretch routine with elements of yoga and sculpting that was not overly difficult or strenuous. I don't know if it earns it's "Power" in the title, but it was effective, especially if you aren't feeling high-energy, but want to get in some work. There is a little Bible-reference "spiritual" warm-up at the beginning.
Didn't realize it was post-natal
love it
Love this video. 3 times a week. Prefect stretch and light workout.
Not for me.
Helps so much.
I didn't choose this DVDs to get bible quotes from a fitness instructor.  Had to turn it off.
I did not order this.

I've been looking for a good Stretch Workout for a while and this is perfect. The scripture reference and prayer at the beginning was a pleasant surprise. I felt totally worked out and stretched at the end.
Very easy to flow!
Easy to follow. Love it is a Christian based workout!
Awesome if your a beginner. Love , love love the fact that this is a Christian based video.
I've always been skeptical of yoga, but this one actually made me break a sweat. It was also somehow easy enough that I could follow along.
I enjoyed the workout.
She is  OK.
It definitely grows on you. Can fast forward if you don't want the meditation. It works!
I do not want to listen to Bible scripture while I am stretching/working out. No thank you.
I love this video.
This video came up in my search for a Prime stretch workout.  It just isn't a very good workout video.  It's a nice Christian video, but I can go to Church for that.

I was looking for a stretching workout that was not Yoga and this is a great fit! It has a spiritual aspect that appears Christian by the use of a pre-workout prayer and the music. I found the exercises to be challenging yet doable. It isn't yoga but uses movements that are yogalike for those who might be uncomfortable with yoga's spiritual connections. My only dislike is that the quality of the video is sometimes pixilated but I'm not sure if that is my TV, internet connection, or the video.
Not for me!
Great music, relaxing feel, good stretches.

What was with all the Christian bullsh*?

I guess they don't care about including the culture that developed these stretches...

It's all yoga, and that came from Hinduism. At least don't say anything so all cultures can participate w/out feeling excluded.

When you need a deep, good stretch and when you appreciate the Christian tone, this is great. It's far slower than you would think when you read the title, but as someone who is just interested in getting a good stretch, this is great and refreshing.

This is basically yoga mixed with some calisthenics, which is what I was hoping for when I clicked this. And when I say yoga I mean the whole shebang, like the meditation, the spiritual music, etc. But there's a twist: It's Christianized. Granted, after the first 5 minutes there aren't really any references to Christianity except what I think is Christian music in the background (but the lyrics weren't clear enough for me to find it interruptive). I loved the workout, I skipped the meditation and prayer at the beginning. I am a religious person, but I didn't click the video for worship, so I skipped that part.

I've never written a review before but I just finished this stretch/strengthen video. I completely understand the dissatisfaction of non-Christian viewers with this video. I'm new to the yoga scene and the Buddha/zen religious elements of many practices are a real turn-off to me. In fact I almost turned this one off when the first heading came up with "spiritual" in the title. Invariably in the yoga world that means I have to listen to someone become one with the universe or some such thing. I was pleasantly surprised when Tonya began quoting from Isaiah and then Matthew. If you are a Christian looking for a good stretch or to start incorporating yoga into your routine, this is a workout that not only won't offend your faith but actually enriches it. Thank you Tonya!
The description of this video misuses commas. The vibe is creepy Christian, and I don't appreciate that that was a surprise. Also, it's not "power stretch and sculpt." It's just dull vinyasa yoga.
Great yoga workout - just like the Body Flow Yoga class I used to attend.  Now I can do it at home whenever I want!  I use it also as a great stretch routine after a hard workout.  Love it!

I didn't realize that there would be such a religious element to this video. In the beginning she quoted scripture from the Bible. I didn't mind that so much because I normally skip through the talking of all the videos I do....but moving into the second phase of the stretching the music changed from wordless songs to a hymn....I think was "I Surrender All".....It just isn't my thing. I found it distracting and ultimately defeated the purpose of me buying the video which was to relax.... I turned it off after a little while. I wish I had been able to rent it first because it as a complete waste to me. However, if you are looking for something easy and relaxing with a Christian emphasis this is definitely for you.
I used this dvd in my day off from exercise and It is very relaxing on my body, it makes me feel great, I really enjoyed it.

I usually do vinyassa flow yoga, and wanted something to just concentrate on stretching.  This was not the video for me.  While she did have some good stretches, it was very easy and slow moving.  I got very bored.  The title "power stretch" mislead me... It should have been restfull stretch for beginners.  Wish I had rented it instead of buying it because I will not be doing the video again.

This is a Christian Beginner to Intermediate Stretching and Toning Workout using a mostly instrumental Christian devotional music soundtrack, NOT a Yoga workout. Christians will enjoy practicing these Yoga-like stretching and toning exercises without the pagan religious overtones. Separate from the workout, the DVD also contains several lovely, short Christian devotionals to motivate and inspire participants in their journey toward better health and fitness. If you love the Bible and the One True God and His Son revealed in it, this Christ-centered stretching and toning workout will be a big blessing to you.
My favorite workout to de-stress. I feel more at ease and ready to tackle the day after this challenging, yet fun yoga workout. Great for the mind, body and soul!

This is a great if your looking for stretching and an all over work out that isn't to strenuous, but still makes you feel that you have accomplished your goal to exercise.  I have several online workouts that I rotate through and I use the Power Stretch & Sculpt in my weekly exercise plan.
I have been doing it every day since July!  Love it.
Very relaxing and low impact. Peaceful and calming.

I love...I love the Devotion and prayer before workout....because I need the prayer to help me do it.

Excellent workout!! My whole body feels stretched and every muscle is alive and activated!

The stretches are fine but the yoga aspects work because of the specific way vinyasas are designed. Tonya edited the sequences and left out important parts while putting in a bunch of religious rambling in the beginning. If you skip the first 5 1/2 minutes and then ignore all the music, the video is then decently mediocre.
not what I thought

Barely finished the video, not because I was put off by the quoting of scriptures, but because I realized what sad shape I'm in.  I was pleasantly surprised at the spiritual aspect of this video, and pleased with the flow and instructions of the stretch and yoga positions.  I liked that I didn't feel that I had to be in exactly the same place as the instructor in terms of condition - that's why I decided to watch the video in the first place.  I do think, as others have expressed, somewhere in the description it should be made clear that there is a Christian spiritual intro to this video. Personally, I appreciate a little prayer to help me into downward dog.
Very relaxing and the perfect amount of time.
This session was excellent!
